items.prompt: The total amount of money you receive after all taxes are taken away is your ___.
items.explanation: El salario neto (net salary) es lo que realmente recibes tras los impuestos.

items.prompt: In most countries, employees ___ pay income tax to the government.
items.explanation: Pagar impuestos es una obligación legal: have to.

items.prompt: You ___ save a portion of your salary every month for emergencies.
items.explanation: Para dar consejos o recomendaciones, usamos 'should'.

items.prompt: Where can I find the details of my deductions? Please check your ___.
items.explanation: La nómina (payslip) muestra los detalles del sueldo y las deducciones.

items.prompt: My ___ is the total amount before any tax is deducted.
items.explanation: El salario bruto (gross salary) es el total antes de impuestos.

items.prompt: A Christmas ___ is an extra payment at the end of the year.
items.explanation: Un 'bonus' es una gratificación o pago extra.

items.prompt: You ___ spend more than you earn if you want to avoid debt.
items.explanation: Consejo negativo: no deberías (shouldn't) gastar más de lo que ganas.

items.prompt: Does he ___ to work on public holidays?
items.explanation: En preguntas con 'Does', usamos 'have to'.

items.prompt: Income ___ is calculated based on how much you earn.
items.explanation: El impuesto sobre la renta se llama 'income tax'.

items.prompt: You ___ check your payslip for mistakes every month.
items.explanation: Es un buen consejo (should) revisar la nómina.

items.prompt: A ___ is usually paid to workers who are paid by the hour.
items.explanation: 'Wage' suele ser el pago por horas o trabajo semanal.

items.prompt: If you don't have to work tomorrow, you ___ wake up early.
items.explanation: Indica ausencia de obligación: no tienes que (don't have to).

items.prompt: The government uses ___ to pay for public services like education.
items.explanation: Los impuestos financian los servicios públicos.

items.prompt: You ___ sign the contract until you understand all the terms.
items.explanation: Consejo de precaución: no deberías (shouldn't) firmar sin entender.

items.prompt: My monthly ___ is 2,500 euros after all deductions.
items.explanation: El ingreso neto (net income) es lo que queda tras las deducciones.

items.prompt: Does your company ___ to provide health insurance?
items.explanation: Pregunta sobre obligación corporativa con 'Does'.

items.prompt: You ___ always keep your payslips for at least a year.
items.explanation: Es una recomendación práctica (should).

items.prompt: If the payment is late, you might have to pay a ___.
items.explanation: Una 'fine' es una multa o penalización.

items.prompt: A fixed monthly payment is usually called a ___.
items.explanation: El pago fijo mensual se denomina 'salary'.

items.prompt: You ___ ask your manager if you have questions about your salary.
items.explanation: Es el curso de acción recomendado (should).
